Review.Titre: Make it user friendly
Review.Contenu: Make it user friendly.  I didn't the time to burn up learning the ins and outs.  It was cheaper for me to purchase Freedom and cut my losses.

Review.Titre: Software slow
Review.Contenu: The software consumes too many resources, is quite slow and the configuration is not very intuitive.

Review.Titre: Had to deinstall FocusMe from computer…
Review.Contenu: Had to deinstall FocusMe from computer was restarting everytime I tried to turn it off. Will try to reinstall.

Review.Titre: PLEASE make it easy to download the…
Review.Contenu: PLEASE make it easy to download the app!! Every time i want to redownload becauase i switch computers or format, i have to go on a scavanger hunt to find the download link. Just have a an easy link on the home page

Review.Titre: Not working
Review.Contenu: It's not working for me. Every time I want to block an ad or website, I click on the FocusMe button. It stays grey and does not do anything. Maybe I am doing something wrong.

Review.Titre: Just isn't there yet
I bought for my kids.
Review.Contenu: I bought for my kids.They found ways to bypass the restrictions.Spent a month or more but failed to achieve my objectives.

Review.Titre: Hard to download
Review.Contenu: Download didn't work. Password had to be set too many times

Review.Titre: So much potential, but can't be trusted.
Review.Contenu: I was on the two week trial, it's possible this would be a different experience outside the trial.During the trial, the app was doing exactly what I needed it to. During the schedule I set, it would prevent gaming and random video/social media surfing, letting me actually have a reasonable sleep schedule. It would pause and hide these apps, but I wouldn't lose progress, and it was very consistent and reliable.The day after my trial ended, the app popped up with a login screen. I attempted to login, the app interface would just lock up, and then randomly apply a schedule for a different time to my computer. Closing/ending the app of course didn't solve the problem, because it is (wisely) designed to relaunch if you try to play fast & loose with it. The only way to make my computer functional after the trial ended was to uninstall the app entirely (Thank goodness I didn't turn on the uninstall protection).In theory, this app is pretty good, and does what it says. But if there's a problem this early into it's use that causes the computer to essentially not work, it seems like a very dangerous app to use or rely on. Disappointing, really...so much potential, but can't be trusted.

Review.Titre: The application works great when it…
Review.Contenu: The application works great when it comes to blocking websites but it is terribly slow when it comes to setting up my plans and schedules. I'm currently using a surface go 2, which while I know isnt the fastest laptop it is definitely a solid one. The only reason I continune to use this is because it is the most strict software on the market.

Review.Titre: Nice app but there is a solution GAP in Windows 10
Review.Contenu: Solution very simple to use but there are other apps and/or solutions which do the same, we can pay less and with more features. Also, there is a solution GAP because it is impossible to define access restrictions at the same time for differents uses in Windows 10. It is necessary to logon on each user at Windows 10 to apply all of restrictions that we want. The app does not do restrictions at the same time for all of them.

Review.Titre: Often wrong windows/tabs are closed…
Review.Contenu: Often wrong windows/tabs are closed because I switched to them near the end of the allotted use period. In Chrome on Android, a tab is closed when I start typing an allowed address but a forbidden one is one of the suggestions.

Review.Titre: First the good thing
Review.Contenu: First the good thing: your product leads the field in unhackability.  Cold Turkey is too easy to disable from the command line, and Freedom is so bad it's barely worth mentioning.  So you are leading this particular niche area of software.  Also, you've been helpful and quick to respond to criticism/offer technical support in the past.What's wrong with your software: it's buggy.  I can't count the number of times it's simply stopped working for no reason.  Or there's been a delay before a list would activate.  Or the fact, that, despite being set to activate at midnight, my plans activate at 4am.Your UI is bad.  There is no reason why, when editing a plan, it should be necessary to cycle through 5 or 6 screens in a linear fashion just to get to the one that I want.  This is particularly true because your program consistently freezes for a few seconds on the second screen of settings.  If you are going to make a UI this annoying, you should at least not be having glitches that cause your program to freeze.  Unforeseen stuff like this is why you should have good UI, a combination of a bug + poorly conceptualized UI makes the bugs even more annoying than they have to be.Secondly, there is no good way to import massive blocklists into plans, too large a copy paste buffer doesn't work and copy paste is the worst way to do this anyways.  You should preserve the copy paste option, but take a page from Cold Turkey and allow for the importation of blocklists in .txt files.Finally, your product, like all "Ulysses Software" should employ a "rabbit snare" principle - be hard to hack, but easy to make more restrictive.  It should be easy to add to blocklists during a locked plan.  The best example of this feature is Cold Turkey, which has a browser extension which allows the addition of any URL to a blocklist with a couple clicks.  As far as I can tell, the FocusMe browser extension doesn't do anything.  If you really want to one up Cold Turkey, make it possible to edit the browser URL when you're adding it, in order to add wildcards.Your product is a frustrating combination of power and immense, untapped potential.  I don't know if there is some deep tradeoff of bugginess you had to accept to get the level of unhackability you have, but the UI stuff could be easily fixed.I also eagerly wait a viable android version of your product, as I currently deal with smartphone by simply uninstalling all social media apps, browsers, and finally the store itself, to make sure I can't reinstall anything.

Review.Titre: It gives flexibility to programme…
Review.Contenu: It gives flexibility to programme according to my distraction habits, which is really good, but I thought it was annoying and intrusive; sometimes the programme froze.

Review.Titre: Good features bad desgin
Review.Contenu: The app is good and the features one has is also good but the design of the app is not good at all. I think that the design of the app gets in the way of all the features and that the app is designed to complicated. There should also be a section of the app where you can see a day overview of all block in a calendar format.

Review.Titre: Failure in design for both app and desktop
Review.Contenu: (Sorry for the broken English)APP : the updating (of the system and/or app, I don't know) makes the app fail to its main purpose : sometimes the app doesn't work, and I can access content. Otherwise very useful.Desktop software : doesn't block youtube content when embedded in other website. For example, I use duckduckgo instead of google : I can watch all youtube video there. Not to compare, but coldturkey can do that, which means its feasible.Mail : too much mails, I stopped reading them

Review.Titre: Promising productivity app.
Review.Contenu: The core functionality is working well since the last update, but for 5 stars the app still needs to be Retina display ready and have iPhone support. Great developer/support team though, so I hope to return with a higher rating as soon as they work out the higher resolution and iOS support.

Review.Titre: I like a lot of the features
Review.Contenu: I like a lot of the features, but find the interface not at all user friendly - it is impossible to scroll down a lot of the time. I'm also finding it difficult to block one particular item, and this is now my main energy sink :(.

Review.Titre: Review FocusMe now.
It took a lot of updates and a little…
Review.Contenu: It took a lot of updates and a little while for it to start working. But I got it to work now. Ask me again later

Review.Titre: The software works reasonably well.
Review.Contenu: The software works reasonably well.But the UI is dated, sluggish, and non-intuitive.

Review.Titre: UI and usage needs improvement
Review.Contenu: While I like the android app, the windows desktop app has an unintuitive UI and I have been unable to configure it for my needs, and keeps showing recurring bugs like maximize button being disabled.  So while the windows app has powerful features, I am unable to actually use them, e.g. to whitelist certain sites only for a set of hours every day including important emails (in gmail) but not other emails.UI issues:1. Usage of column heading like RULE instead of something more user friendly.2. The actual value for RULE is truncated in length and have to hover over it to see the full text (note: this problem would go away if maximize button or resizing of window works).  But ideally, I would like to increase width of only RULE column.3. Not sure how whitelist works. If I give a few sites to whitelist, then I expect that timer should run if any websites apart from these whitelisted websites are being used.  But on usage, it seems I have to enter some blacklisted sites also and only then the timer will run.  In that case, it is not clear how to blacklist all websites except whitelisted ones.4. The settings for a plan makes you jump sequentially through 6 dialog windows, when it could have been made into tabbed or a more compressed kind of UI with ability to set multiple parameters on same window.5. Sometimes, the settings will result in a window being blocked when I do not think it should have been as per my configured parameters.All in all, I have spent quite some time but unable to configure it for my needs.  I will probably wait till the UI and settings are improved.

Review.Titre: A good tool for increasing discipline.
Review.Contenu: A good tool for increasing discipline.I use it to limit the time I spend gaming. Even without hitting the limits I set myself, I notice that I reduce the time I game on any given day, because I want to keep some reserve.What should be improved, however, is the userfriendliness. It's not always obvious how certain rules can be set up, the interface is a bit clunky.

Review.Titre: I love the app on my computer
Review.Contenu: I love the app on my computer; please work on getting an Android app that works on my version of Android OS. The Google Play Store shows an app but only works on my older phone. For reference, I'm running Android ver.13, One UI version 5.1 on a Galaxy S22.

Review.Titre: Extremly helpful - with minor weaknesses
Review.Contenu: Really helpful for me to fight the monkey mind. I have almost entire control over each detail of my work plan. E.g. regular expression patterns applied on the URLs allow me to precisely define whitelists. Some weaknesses : - not available for Linux - slow during operation

Review.Titre: I have been using FocusMe for a long…
Review.Contenu: I have been using FocusMe for a long time and I love it, especially the support. Also the programm ist very cheap, a 3 year license cost me 50$. But it also has flaws which is why I just cannot give it the five stars I would really love to give. 1. The Android App has straightforward been abandoned. I think the last update occourred like two years ago, misses a lot of features and has never worked properly on my two cellphones. 2. The Computerprogramm works and gets regular updated, but over time I stumbled upon flaws that were just never fixed:- YouTube Links opened via Whatsapp-Web/ Telegramm etc. don't get detected- FocusMe doesn't work on Opera GX, either the site doesn't get detected or it gets detected but doesn't get closed.Apart from this the program is lovely and I am sure at some point these issues will be fixed, so it is great to maintain a focus for yourself or other people.

Review.Titre: Great tool, but statistics page needs improvement
Review.Contenu: Great tool for making you more productive! Curbed my need to surf the internet for hours.The statistic page to view your time spend has unfortunately some bugs!

Review.Titre: I already use FocusMe and I want so…
Review.Contenu: I already use FocusMe and I want so say...it's really really great! The PC version is really great, but for Android...I had some problems that make this don't work nice for me: first, when I close application, the protection just don't work anymore :/ I already task the option ''protect FocusMe unninstall or disable'', but stills with the same bug.

Review.Titre: Synchronization between the windows app…
Review.Contenu: Synchronization between the windows app and the android app is lacking. There is no transitivity between plans configured in windows app and the android app. I actually prefer focusme to the freedom app. However, the freedom app achieved perfect synch between windows and android phone. I think that is essential for mantaining a good "focus" on your work (not getting distracted by other devices that are not synchronized with the app). I read that focusme is working on this. I hope they get it done briefly.

Review.Titre: this app has been amazing as it has given me more energy! seriusly
Review.Contenu: this app has been amazing as it has blocked my access to some online which serve as distraction - including pornography material which is a current epidemic - worldwideNow, it would be great if the adult blocking option is based on dns server as well as keyword. I do hope for this program to continue developing and to see its ads on YouTube!!

Review.Titre: Really Useful!
Review.Contenu: This is a great application. It's a bit pricey, and could be more user-friendly, but it has been a lifesaver for me. As an online student, I'm able to control which apps and websites I have access to at what time, and this is so helpful for time management. I like that there are different levels of password protection - the random character generator password is my favourite because it's enough of a deterrent when I simply want to scroll social media, but if i really need to stop the plan it is still possible. I would definitely recommend this for people with a serious procrastination problem, like myself.

Review.Titre: The best software of its kind
Review.Contenu: The best software of its kind that I found. The random password freature is very good. Saves me hundred of hours per year of distractions. Really recommend it for people struggling with self control in the computer. The android app still needs a lot of freatures present in the PC app though.

Review.Titre: It works and the support even answers on weekends
Review.Contenu: I really wish there was an IOS app, the normal apple screen time is a bit limiting. The desktop app is amazing though, saved me a lot of hours of watching youtube.

Review.Titre: It's great, it's good
Review.Contenu: Everything is great, just sometimes my account got disconnected and i have to contact the support to have my license key back.Otherwise it's very great, it helps a lot on my studies and my professional project. Thank you.

Review.Titre: It's the same app that works
Review.Contenu: It's the same app that works. Though I feel it's a little bit unoptimized for newer OS because it feels a little slow between each actions

Review.Titre: Great app overall
Review.Contenu: Great app overall. You have lots of flexibility in how to set it up. It's not always perfect (eg: adult sites blocker blocked me from filling out a form on gov.uk because the url had 'sex' in it as it was asking for gender). But have been using it for over a year now and am overall very happy with it.

Review.Titre: Customer support is perfect
Review.Contenu: Customer support is perfect, the only problem is that in browser when it closes tabs from specific sites I checked for, it also closes tabs from sites I didn't say to close, mostly when those tabs are close to each other.

Review.Titre: A good app with great customer support
Review.Contenu: A good app with great customer support. It provides a useful nudge to keep off the games or twitter when you are supposed to be working.

Review.Titre: Focusme is great when it comes to…
Review.Contenu: Focusme is great when it comes to Windows devices like but sucks when used in Android smartphones.

Review.Titre: It's good
Review.Contenu: It really does help, keep you away from distractions, and increase your productivity.

Review.Titre: I love how FocusMe works and helps…
Review.Contenu: I love how FocusMe works and helps keeps my kids and I on track. I just want it to be available for Chromebook tablets as well!

Review.Titre: Clunky, but robust and flexible - heartfelt recommendation!
Review.Contenu: This is the most robust and fully featured distraction blocker of the ones I've tried. Flexibility in terms of scheduling (timer, specific hours of the day, no. of app/website launches etc.) and the level of security of the block (password protection, incl. randomly generated char. sequences, or a "nuclear"/forced mode) are essential to making it a good long-term solution that reduces stress instead of adding it. I've been really impressed with the forced mode (i.e., the one you can't turn off at all).Customer service is also great, in my experience. My license was auto-renewed, but the old one expiring meant that the app logged me out and stopped the plans that were running. I created a support ticket in panic on Friday afternoon and didn't expect to hear from them until Monday/Tuesday, but got a response within just a few hours, which means that I have a much higher chance of staying productive throughout this weekend.All in all, for me, it's definitely worth the asking price and I want to strongly encourage any ADHD brains out there (or anyone with less-than-stellar executive function, really) to take FocusMe for a spin and see if it works well for them.There are some downsides to be aware of, though: - the interface could use a touch-up; right now it's sometimes a little confusing even for me and I consider myself tech-savvy (don't let it scare you away from trying the app, though -- a few minutes of clicking every button you see should be enough to help you orient yourself);- on a related note, the license renewal issue described a few paragraphs above... simply should not have happened -- I'd expect the license reactivation to be automated and not stop active plans (upd.: Jon Rumens reached out to me and explained that the expected behaviour is indeed auto-reactivation, so, while the reason it didn't trigger in my case is still shrouded in mystery, I thought I'd downgrade this particular point from "a feature not thought out" to "a weird bug that was surprising to FocusMe team as much as it was for me");- the mobile app has not been working great for me, unfortunately -- to the point where sometimes the apps that were supposed to be blocked simply weren't. I suspect this is something that could be resolved with more tinkering, but I simply put the mobile app aside at some point. Most of my deathscrolling happens on PCs anyway + Android has a decent digital wellbeing app that works well enough for me.So yeah, while there are definitely things about FocusMe that feel janky and seem to require more manual tuning than should be necessary, but on the flip side you do get a very robust and flexible system that can't be fooled by simply killing the process / opening a browser window in incognito mode / restarting the PC.

Review.Titre: Overall the functionality of FocusMe is…
Review.Contenu: Overall the functionality of FocusMe is great. For one, it actually works and blocks things as it should. I have used other programs that do not. Also there are so many options for what you can control and limit. I gave 4 stars because there are small things about the user experience and interface that either are a bit clunky or confusing. But overall great product and glad I purchased.

Review.Titre: It works and does what you want
Review.Contenu: This app is simple enough to get the job done, and expansive enough to customise if you want to. Of the four productivity apps I tried, this was the best option. Being able to block certain apps and websites on both phone and laptop has given me increased focus.The android app is free, and it gets the job done, but not too elegant (i miss the predefined lists of the pc app). Five stars when the phone app can link to the pc app.

Review.Titre: Great features, poor interface, excellent customer support
Review.Contenu: FocusMe has great features and multiple options for customization as well as great customer support. However, its interface is not delivering the user experience expected from a leading service that is billed monthly in 2019. The interface feels unresponsive and often gets in the way when setting up plans. The experience for creating a new plan or editing an existing one is somewhat intuitive but not particularly seamless or enjoyable.

Review.Titre: Never paid for an app my entire life
Review.Contenu: Never paid for an app my entire life. But this one, I was glad to sign up for a 1-year membership plan. The tool is great, the customer service is wonderful, with Jon responding to my email himself, and the price was reasonable. The reason why I gave it a 4-star instead of 5 is that the app's UI could do better. I'd love to see a more user-friendly and fresher look.

Review.Titre: works well
Review.Contenu: works well. at times, though - it crashes when a plan blocks a website. and then i can access the website. which defeats the purpose. or it randomly stops recognising the websites i am going on, which means i can access any website. defeats its own prupose a lot and i end up wasting a lot of time because i trusted this software.4 stars instead of 3 because customer support is responsive to a good level, and fixes problems.

Review.Titre: Excellent for those of us without enough self-control
Review.Contenu: I love the fact that it is so difficult to bypass (if you choose that option, of course). I'ts excellent to keep you focused, it has helped me a lot, and the only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because it lacks more options, e.g. I'd like to set some apps to be just blocked and other apps to be allowed for a certain time interval in the same plan.

Review.Titre: Great customer support
Review.Contenu: When it works, it is great. Often have to close out and reopen or work some other voodoo to be able to click on the button to launch the time windowUPDATE: I have changed my review to reflect 4 stars. The customer support these guys offered was pretty incredible. Technical issues persisted but they offered great hand-holding and weekly check-ins. I now use this product every day.

Review.Titre: The functionality is great
Review.Contenu: The functionality is great, but for some reason I just don't use it consistentlyIn response to the below:This has more to do with the way I use the app rather than the app itself.  I have focusapp installed on two computers, my home desktop and my laptop.  Both computers come with their own distractions.  Disabling the distractions via the app is not as effective as simply taking my laptop to a place where there's no wi-fi.

Review.Titre: The best way to stay focused
Review.Contenu: This is probably the best way to stay focused on your computer, mainly because you can block apps as well as websites. It is still a little rough around the edges, but no major problems. I would recommend FocusMe over all other solutions (and I've tried a lot of them).

Review.Titre: Superior to other anti-procrastination apps, but not perfect
Review.Contenu: Helps me to stay productive, whenever I remember to turn it on. I love that I'm able to have several different "sessions" running at the same time, such as one that prevents me from procrastinating at school as well as one that blocks my entire computer before bed. I have a few minor complaints - I wish it was easier to navigate and to add websites and apps. Is it really necessary to click the "Next" button 8 times to set up a plan? Is it necessary to search through every single app running on the computer to find something, rather than using an interface akin to the Windows "Apps and Features" one?

Review.Titre: Does what it is supposed to do
Review.Contenu: I just found a  setting that allows to block access to privacy settings. I can run it in forced mode without being able to outsmart it. Is is difficult to find this setting which is why I oversaw it the first time when I used the app. The response of the person that works for focus is not entirely correct. The option to block your privacy settings is available in trial mode as well! I deduct one star because the user interface is a bit clunky and the focusme employee who responded to me should know his own product better since the setting is available in trial mode! I am satisfied and find this app useful!

Review.Titre: Good but can still improve.
Review.Contenu: The app is really good in the sense that it provides a lot many customization to fit your work mode, It has really helped me to stay away from wasting time in Youtube and other unproductive sites. But still there are browsers which are not covered by FocusMe, like SIDEKICK PRIVATE BROWSER, LUNASCAPE etc. The app developers can work towards making it universally applicable to all browsers or stop using other browsers.What I have done is , I stopped my access to downloading other browsers by adding the words browsing apps, browsers etc to RegEx feature of FocusMe , and blocked all other known browsers.Anyway they does a good job. Cheers !!

Review.Titre: Recommendable App
Review.Contenu: Focus Me is an awesome app and helped me in many things, such as staying awake not longer than I want to.One star is missing, because I think it is to expensive and because I can not install Focus Me on my phone.

Review.Titre: Great program, one critique
Review.Contenu: So far, I'm really enjoying this program. Its been able to help me stay productive. It works very smoothly, and I love the option to create a random password of any character length: this allows me to access certain websites when I absolutely need them and keeps me from accessing them when I don't. My only critique is that, when I've set it to restrict some websites/apps to a certain time length per day (ie: only use Youtube for 1 hour per day), sometimes it doesn't accurately record the amount of time I spend on those websites/apps, and allows me a lot more time on them then what I've programmed. This might be a fault on my end, I'm not sure, but thought it would be worth mentioning.

Review.Titre: practical and very swift personal help
Review.Contenu: John and his team are very fast in responding to questions about software issues. I have never seen this before in any other firm!  And thus Focus Me works very well for me. Win10. Try it, and you will notice it !

Review.Titre: No prebuilt profiles for Android.
Review.Contenu: No prebuilt profiles for Android.There is also a small glitch in the Android app where it says you've spent 10 minutes on a time wasting app, where as you may have spent 50 minutes on it.

Review.Titre: Almost 5 stars but interface isn't…
Review.Contenu: Almost 5 stars but interface isn't quite smooth enough just yet. The features are fantastic and if you're wanting to blokck sites permanently when setting up 'plan' simply set it to forced mode. I'd recommend not setting it to last all day for a couple weeks to see if you don't ever want to access certain sites again.Sometimes when trying to do 'quick add' to an existing plan it takes multiple clicks of the mouse to be able to type into the field. All in all great service and it will only improve with time.I've just noticed as well (after initially leaving the review) that there is app and web browsing analysis that shows how much time you spend on what sites or apps, this is another great feature.

Review.Titre: The tool is great
Review.Contenu: The tool is great, for me what is missing is two things:1) Plans syncs between notebooks/phone.2) Possibility to add plan using an external calendar (sync both ways)Kinds Regards,

Review.Titre: Powerful app & website blocker
Review.Contenu: UPDATED: Recent updates to FocusMe seem to have fixed some issues we had on Windoze 7 and the developer follow-up to my concerns is much appreciated!A fantastically flexible application and website blocker that is sure to improve your productivity and/or limit your kids' computer time!Unfortunately the interface design isn't as easy to use as [I think] it could be, and I experienced some issues on Windows 7 that seem to have been fixed in a recent update.Also note that website filtering is only based on matching URLs (e.g. social media) or patterns in page titles (e.g. porn), so you won't be able to choose categories of community-currated black/white lists ala OpenDNS for example.This product lives up to it's name and it's obvious that the developer is committed to continually improving it. Recommended!

Review.Titre: Excellent tool to block unwanted…
Review.Contenu: Excellent tool to block unwanted distraction. Blocks websites, apps, software in any way you like. Interface could use some polish, but that's about it.

Review.Titre: Amazing tool
Review.Contenu: Amazing tool, it's been helping me a lot. Highly recommend. Only thing it that I wish it was a bit easier to navigate. Interface could be improved.

Review.Titre: I am reasonably comfortable with this…
Review.Contenu: I am reasonably comfortable with this software. Though it does have considerable control over computer operations, which does make me slightly nervous.

Review.Titre: It helped me keep my addiction in…
Review.Contenu: It helped me keep my addiction in check,in order to achieve a greater life value overall.Their customer service is very good,fast and reliable.

Review.Titre: My inner procrastinator hates FocusMe, but I love it.
Review.Contenu: As I once wrote in an email exchange with Jon, the founder (who, BTW, goes to great lengths to engage personally with his customers), I love FocusMe and I hate FocusMe in roughly equal measure.  Let me finish ;-).  I love FocusMe because it is hands down the most effective control I have found over the many distractions to which I previously allowed myself to fall prey; and I hate FocusMe when I feel inclined to procrastinate because I simply can not find a way to break it.  And believe me, I've tried.  I quickly became adept at breaking the other apps in its class but FocusMe has me beat, making it entirely effective at helping me focus on what I need to focus on.The only thing holding back the 5th star here is that the UX is a little clunky, and it lacks the ability to synchronise and control plans across my multiple devices.  I believe that feature and improved UX are on their way, so I look forward to continued improvements in this fantastic product.

Review.Titre: This app is incredibly useful for me
Review.Contenu: This app is incredibly useful for me. Sometimes I find the interface a little confusing, so that's why it's 4 stars instead of 5.

Review.Titre: This app really did the job for me
Review.Contenu: This app really did the job for me, easy to use and light, and most of all I haven't had any bugs with it. Consistency is appreciated

Review.Titre: one of the main reasons that made me…
Review.Contenu: one of the main reasons that made me more productive and disciplined by cutting distractions and focus more on what's matter

Review.Titre: Even though I know it’s complicated to…
Review.Contenu: Even though I know it’s complicated to do with iOS, I’d love to have FocusMe on iPhone. Otherwise it works well.

Review.Titre: Very good software
Review.Contenu: Very good software. Has stopped me wasting hours on the internet every day. Hours that I use to work now.

Review.Titre: Pretty Good
Review.Contenu: Could have better interface. Lacking some features but better than all other blockers I have found.

Review.Titre: good system with 1 setback..
Review.Contenu: If devices could sync, it would be 5 stars.  I do find this product helpful with my time management

Review.Titre: Excellent tool to stop wasting days
Review.Contenu: Focus Me is flexible to set up, with many options to specify the precise controls needed for focus on what is truly important. Important is the fact that once set up, it is really difficult to change settings. It ships me just seeing what is happening on Twitter, or on the news, and suddenly it is the end of the day and I've done nothing. It's exactly what I need.The Android version isn't as high functioning, which is a shame. It also has some difficulties specific to certain phones. We have a Huawei, an OPPO and a Samsung in the house, and we have difficulty in the first two cases but not on the Samsung. That isn't the fault of Focus Me, but it's a shame. I need to restart the app more often than I'd like, and I can lose focus because of it. Purchasing the app was a bit less obvious, as I didn't get a message telling me I'd been successful, and purchased two. Customer service are excellent, however, and I received an immediate refund on one. They were also good and responsive with some of the technical problems with the Android version, which is not wholly successful but due to Huawei peculiarities rather than the app.Very strongly recommend the computer version, and I how the Android version develops a little more.

Review.Titre: DON'T BE PUT OFF BY THE 4 STARS
Review.Contenu: DON'T BE PUT OFF BY THE 4 STARS. I'll explain why FocusMe is missing one star. But honestly apart of that is an absolutely phenomenal filter system. No.1 in the world. It is totally unmatched. I'd rate it 9 out of 10 if I could. 4/5 is not doing it justice. I absolutely love FocusMe. The software is so extraordinarily intelligent, sophisticated, smart, robust and indestructible. No filter system in the world comes anything even close to FocusMe on the PC. Literally none.Want to block the TV show "Big Brother", but don't want to block the words big and brother individually? Focus Me lets you do that. Want to block the word videos, but want to allow the phrase 'Maths videos'? Focus Me lets you do that. Want to block Bing Images and Videos, but not Mail, Maps, Flights, OneDrive? Focus Me lets you do that. Want to time-limit how long you spend on a search engine, or searching on YouTube?  Focus Me lets you do that. I mean it's just so exceptionally smart. NOW the ONLY thing that I'm disappointed with Focusme is that, the blockage isn't as instantaneous! So if I attempt to search something I've blocked, there's a delay of 2 seconds before it's blocked. That's probably not a problem for many users. But for me, if that 2 seconds is enough to expose me to images which I can't forget about.

Review.Titre: Definitely like the concept, still learning to use it and make it work properly
Review.Contenu: I'm still learning to use it and like it overall, but so far I'm having issues with functions on the desktop version. For a couple social media sites, I chose to only allow 3 launches per day of 15 minutes per launch with a minimum of 4 hours between launches. I also set up a window of time in the day when that is supposed to be active. However, it doesn't keep track of the time between launches when the computer is not on (so if I have 2 hours left before I can launch my "second time for the day," but then I close my computer and come back to it a few hours later, it still says I have 2 hours left before I can launch again). It also is not keeping track of the number of launches per day, it just cycles through 1, 2, and 3 over the course of multiple days rather than restarting at 1 each day (including not counting the break time while the computer is off...so if I open my computer in the morning, I may have time left in a "break" even though it's a new day). Hard to explain, but basically, it's not working like I think it should based on how I set it up and I need to figure it out (which is a tall order since the desktop app is kind of clunky and hard to understand at first). TLDR: Good concept, but the details are not super intuitive or seamless in function. Still think it will be good to use for the year once I figure it out
